intro: Sedum zokuriense, commonly known as the Zokuri sedum, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It features fleshy, upright stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its ability to store water in its thick leaves. It blooms in late summer, adding a delicate floral display to its natural habitat. Sedum zokuriense is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
